Senses & Vision

Perception abilities beyond normal human senses

Standard Vision

Most creatures can see in bright light and dim light within a normal range.

Special Senses

Blindsight

Perceive your surroundings without relying on sight, within a specific radius. Creatures with Blindsight can perceive their environment even in darkness or when blinded.

  • Detects creatures that are invisible or hidden
  • Not fooled by illusions
  • Range typically 10-60 feet

Darkvision

See in darkness (both magical and nonmagical) as if it were dim light, within a specific radius (usually 60 feet).

  • You can see in dim light as if it were bright light
  • You can see in darkness as if it were dim light
  • Can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray
  • Range typically 60 or 120 feet

Tremorsense

Detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a specific radius, provided you and the source are in contact with the same ground or substance.

  • Perceive creatures touching the ground
  • Can detect burrowing creatures
  • Doesn't work through the air
  • Range typically 10-60 feet

Truesight

The ultimate form of perception within a specific radius:

  • See in normal and magical darkness
  • See invisible creatures and objects
  • Automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saves against them
  • Perceive the original form of shapechangers and creatures transformed by magic
  • See into the Ethereal Plane
  • Range typically 10-120 feet

Light and Visibility

Bright Light

Normal vision. Most creatures can see normally.

Dim Light (Lightly Obscured)

Creates a lightly obscured area:

  • Disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight
  • Examples: patchy fog, moderate foliage

Darkness (Heavily Obscured)

Creates a heavily obscured area:

  • Blocks vision entirely
  • Creatures are effectively Blinded when trying to see through it
  • Examples: complete darkness, opaque fog, dense foliage
